title: How to Get Rid of Mildew

methods.name: Get Rid of Mildew in the Bathroom

steps.headline: Create a cleaning solution by mixing 1 cup (240mL) chlorine bleach with 1 gallon of warm water (3.75 liters).
Rub the affected area with a brush or rag dipped in the solution.
Rinse the area with water after the solution has been allowed to sit for a couple of minutes.
Turn on the vent fan, if available, upon leaving the bathroom.
steps.description: The fan will help deter mildew growth by circulating the air and removing moisture.

methods.name: Get Rid of Mildew on Wooden Furniture

steps.headline: Vacuum loose spores from the furniture.
steps.description: Throw away the vacuum bag or clean the collection container afterward to prevent re-infestation of mildew.

steps.headline: Wipe the area with a small amount of mild dishwashing detergent mixed with warm water.
steps.description: Use a damp, not soaked, rag to prevent over wetting the furniture, which can damage the wood.

steps.headline: Allow the furniture to dry, and then use a wood furniture polish.
steps.description: If the musty mildew smell persists, add a small amount of baking soda inside of drawers, allow it to sit for several minutes, and then vacuum it out.

methods.name: Get Rid of Mildew on Fabrics

steps.headline: Rinse the garment and place the soiled piece of fabric outside in the direct sunlight.
steps.description: Because the mold grows best in dark and damp places, the sun is a natural predator of mildew. Allow the garment to remain in the sun until it is completely dry.

steps.headline: Use a wire brush to brush away the mildew spores.
steps.description: It is important to do this while still outside, in order not to distribute the mildew back into your home.

steps.headline: Cover the affected area with all-fabric bleach and allow it to soak for about 30 minutes before washing in the machine.
